Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass vs. Intensive Medical Management for Type 2 Diabetes

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to RYGB (n=19) or Why WAIT (n=19).

Participants.evidence: Participants aged 21-65 years with type 2 diabetes diagnosed over a year prior, a BMI of 30-42, and HbA1c ≥6.5% were included.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to RYGB (n=19) or Why WAIT (n=19).

Objective.evidence: This study aims to assess the feasibility of conducting a larger trial to evaluate the long-term effects of Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB) compared to an intensive diabetes medical and weight management program (Why WAIT).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients achieving fasting plasma glucose <126 mg/dL and HbA1c <6.5% at 1 year.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomised to RYGB (n=19) or Why WAIT (n=19).

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 1 year, 58% of RYGB patients achieved the primary outcome compared to 16% in the Why WAIT group (P=0.03).
